oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Variation of arbutin content in Bergenia sp. leaves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Galambosi, B.
Galambosi, Zs.
Siivari, J.
Siivari, K.
Sankelo, T.
Shikov, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The common garden perennial, Bergenia, should be utilized as a special new crop for raw material production in the cosmetic industry, producing arbutin. Under open field and full sun conditions, the arbutin contents of Bergenia leaves have not changed significantly.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Galambosi, B.; Galambosi, Zs.; Siivari, J.; Siivari, K.; Sankelo, T. and Shikov, A. (2007) Variation of arbutin content in Bergenia sp. leaves. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, pp. 36-37.
